faq.title: Frequently Asked
faq.subtitle: Answers to the most common questions about our services, processes, and work methods.

items.q: How does the development process work?
items.a: Our process follows 4 stages: 1) Briefing and requirements analysis, 2) Prototyping and design, 3) Development with weekly sprints, 4) Testing, adjustments, and delivery. You follow everything in real time.

items.q: How long does it take to develop a project?
items.a: It depends on complexity. A landing page takes 5 to 10 days. A complete web system can take 4 to 12 weeks. After the briefing, we provide a detailed timeline.
We accept bank transfer (SWIFT), PayPal, and credit card. For larger projects, we split into installments tied to each stage delivery.

items.q: Do you offer support after delivery?
items.a: Yes! All projects include 30 days of free support after delivery. We also offer monthly maintenance plans for continuous updates.

items.q: Can the scope be changed during the project?
items.a: Yes, we work with agile methodology. Scope changes are evaluated and, if necessary, we adjust the timeline and budget together with the client.
Yes! We develop mobile apps using React Native, which allows creating apps for iOS and Android with a single codebase, reducing costs and time.

items.q: How does the contract model work?
items.a: We work with a service agreement that details scope, timeline, values, and conditions. Everything is transparent and aligned before the start.

items.q: Can I follow the project progress?
items.a: Yes! We provide access to a tracking dashboard and hold weekly alignment meetings to ensure everything is on track.
Yes! We serve clients worldwide. Our team works across multiple time zones and communicates in Portuguese, English, and Spanish.
